intro: Eriocoma lemmonii subsp. lemmonii, commonly known as the Lemmon's eriocoma, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage that gives it a distinctive appearance. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly habitats, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are small and clustered, usually appearing in shades of white or pale pink. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and nectar for pollinators.
